intro: Stoebe stenostachya, commonly known as narrow-stalked devil's-bit manna, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its unique floral structure and historical significance make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
